H0.text: The kinetic molecular theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H1.text: Molecular theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H2.text: Charles's Law is the theory of gases that explains the behavior of ideal gases.

H3.text: Kinetic theory explains the behavior of ideal gases.

A4.text: The kinetic theory of gases is a simple classical model of the thermodynamic behavior of gases.

A5.text: The kinetic theory of gases uses their collisions with each other and with the walls of their container to explain the relationship between the macroscopic properties of gases, such as volume, pressure, and temperature, as well as transport properties such as viscosity, thermal conductivity and mass diffusivity.
